alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Davidson and central Randolph Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Asheboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Asheboro, North Carolina Zoo, Ramseur, Denton, Franklinville and Ulah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind.
